DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy And Agent Multimodality Therapy Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to identify the name of a Radiation Therapy + Agent multimodality therapy regimen was administered to an individual.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy And Agent Multimodality Therapy Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (RAY-dee-AY-shun) The use of high-energy radiation from x-rays, gamma rays, neutrons, and other sources to kill cancer cells and shrink tumors. Radiation may come from a machine outside the body (external-beam radiation therapy) or from materials called radioisotopes. Radioisotopes produce radiation and can be placed in or near the tumor or in the area near cancer cells. This type of radiation treatment is called internal radiation therapy, implant radiation, interstitial radiation, or brachytherapy. Systemic radiation therapy uses a radioactive substance, such as a radiolabeled monoclonal antibody, that circulates throughout the body._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)_Therapy that combines more than one method of treatment._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Radiation Therapy And Agent Multimodality Therapy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):Therapy that combines more than one method of treatment.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
Use of two or more simultaneous or consecutive treatment modalities; e.g., surgery + radiation, or radiation + immunotherapy. Does not refer to use of two or more chemotherapeutic agents.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
